events.name: GDG DevBeer
events.description: Come and hangout with likeminded developers from Zürich to share experiences, enjoy beer and get to know some new people.

events.name: Android session: Introduction to Android development
events.description:
This event will give you an introduction to Android development. There will be two presentations during the evening, to get you started with the basics. This session is mainly intended for developers with java knowledge and poor or no Android knowledge at all.

To participate, please sign up here: 
https://introduction-to-android-development.eventbrite.com﻿

Presenter: Kaspar von Gunten

Event schedule:

18:00 Meeting in the Lobby. Apero & Pizza is served. Be on time

18:30 Talk 1 - Introduction to Android Development Part 1

19:30 Break

20:00 Talk 2 - Introduction to Android Development Part 2

21:29 Official End

21:30 Beer in a Bar next door

Hope to see you there!

events.name: Android sessions: Introduction to Android development Part II
events.description:
This is the second event to give you an introduction to Android development. There will be two presentations during the evening, to get you started with the basics. This session is mainly intended for developers with java knowledge and poor or no Android knowledge at all.

To participate, please sign up here : 
</a><a href="http://gdgzh-android-session-2.eventbrite.com/?aff=meetup">http://gdgzh-android-session-2.eventbrite.com

Presenters: Mikael Alfredsson & Patrick Boos


Event schedule:

18:00 Meeting and sign in in the Lobby. Apero & Snack food is served.

18:30 Talk 1 - Introduction to Android Development Part 1

19:30 Break

20:00 Talk 2 - Introduction to Android Development Part 2

21:29 Official End

21:30 Beer in a Bar next door

Hope to see you there!

events.name: IO Extended Zürich
events.description:
The Google IO conference will take place in San Francisco on 25-25th of June. Only a few lucky ones got tickets to go, if you did not but are still interested in it, we are hosting an IO Extended Zürich event at the local Google office.

We will watch the keynote together and you will get the chance to see the pitches for the Android Wear Hackathon (http://www.hackathon.io/io14 for more hackaton info&signup)  and vote on the best project.

Get your ticket for IO Extended on Eventbrite, http://io14zh.eventbrite.com/

events.name: DevBeer & I/O Debriefing
events.description:
Join us for a DevBeer and Google I/O Debriefing at Reithalle. We had a great time at I/O and would love to share our experience with you. We will bring some of the swag we got, so if you are curious about Android Wear watches, this is the perfect opportunity to try ours out. 

Please confirm your attendance as we need to make a reservation.

Looking forward to seeing you there!

events.name: Android Meet & Share
events.description:
When developing our own small side projects or parts of larger projects at work, we've all encountered similar issues with development, so why not make use of our awesome community and talk about it! :) 

This event is about sharing experiences and meeting like minded people. It is less formal than our other events, in that the idea here is that anyone can present their android projects and have open discussions about them. 

If you would like to present your own project, please contact us and let us know. No project or idea is too small to be presented. 

This Android Meet & Share is sponsored by Tutti.ch. 

It will be in the Tamedia office. Event starts at 18.00. We will meet at the reception and go the venue together. Please be on time. If you are not, let the receptionist know on your arrival and we will come get you.

Get your ticket on: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/android-meet-share-tickets-13041235687

Looking forward to seeing you there!

events.name: Android Meet & Share
events.description:
When developing our own small side projects or parts of larger projects at work, we've all encountered similar issues with development, so why not make use of our awesome community and talk about it! :) 

This event is about sharing experiences and meeting like minded people. It is less formal than our other events, in that the idea here is that anyone can present their android projects and have open discussions about them. 

If you would like to present your own project, please contact us and let us know. No project or idea is too small to be presented. 

This Android Meet & Share is sponsored by Simplificator. 

The meetup is limited to 25 people. To attend please get your ticket here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/android-meet-share-simplificator-tickets-13784637221

Looking forward to seeing you there!

events.name: Year end event - Intel XDK - Dart
events.description:
We are pleased to invite you to the last GDG Zürich event this year. The topics will be Intel's XDK and Dart.

Gregor Biswanger (http://about.me/gregor.biswanger) will get you an intro to Intel’s XDK and cross platform development and what you need to play around with it, this talk will be on German (see description at the bottom).

Nicolas Garnier, who is now a DevRel in the Dart Team will give you some insights in using Dart not only as client but as server language.

Get your ticket on Eventbrite: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/gdg-zurich-year-end-event-registration-14820322985?aff=meetup

Looking forward to see you there!

events.name: Introduction to Docker its ecosystem and monitoring
events.description:
You must register for this event also on Eventbrite: 
docker-event-gdgzh.eventbrite.com

Docker is changing the world of virtualization and has become an integral part of many modern principles of software development and operations to build, pack, ship and run any application as a lightweight container.

Docker is the most common containerization software in use today. While other containerizing systems exist, Docker makes container creation and management simple and integrates with many open source projects.

Presentations

Introduction to Docker in context of a microservice architecture

Introduction into Docker and why Docker is revolutionizing the work of developers and operations in context of a microservice architecture.

Presenter: Vadim Bauer, 8gears AG
Duration: 30-45 Minutes

Docker and its ecosystem

The ecosystem around Docker is the main reason for Dockers popularity. Georg is going to give you an overview on how everything should play together.

Presenter: Georg Kunz, CloudGear
Duration: 30-45 Minutes

Docker monitoring at Swisscom

Presenter: Brian Christner, Swisscom
Duration: 30-45 Minutes

events.name: The Promise of Virtual Reality with Noah Falstein
events.description:
Meet Noah Falstein the game designer and producer of game classics such as Indiana Jones or Battlehawks 1942. Noah is Chief Game Designer at Google and will provide you with an inspirational perspective on the significance of VR, and a description of Googles Cardboard and Project Tango initiatives as ways of exploring the space.

Schedule
17:30 - Doors open
18:00 - Principles of game design
19:00 - The Promise of Virtual Reality, Noah Falstein, Chief Game Designer Google 

Target audience 
Game Designer and developer interested in creating computer or mobile games. 

Event location 
Google or ZHDK not yet defined.

More info and registration

events.name: DevFest 2015
events.description:
The biggest Google tech conference in Switzerland carefully crafted for you by GDG Zürich! All the latest about Android, Web, Cloud, and UX.

More information: http://gdgzh.ch/events/devfest-2015/

events.name: Google IO Extended Zürich 2016
events.description:
We are excited to announce that this years I/O Extended will be take place in the beautiful offices of localsearch on the 18th of May. The venue is a bit different from previous years, having sofas and tables, rather than rows of chairs. We will watch the keynote together drink some beer and talk about technology. And of course we have some T-Shirts and other swag for you.

We will have some time to to socialize before and after the live streaming and if you would like to use the time to give a short (2-5 min) pitch about a topic, do contact us and we arrange it. This could be teasing about a possible presentation topic to gather response from the crowd or just introducing yourself to break the ice.

A big thanks to localsearch for sponsoring us and making this event possible!

events.name: Google IO extended 2017
events.description:
We are excited to announce that this years I/O Extended will be at the Google's Huerlimann campus (in building Brandschenkestrasse 110).

We will watch the keynote together drink some beer and talk about technology. And of course we have some T-Shirts and other swag for you.

We will have some time to to socialize before and after the live streaming and if you would like to use the time to give a short (2-5 min) pitch about a topic, do contact us and we arrange it. This could be teasing about a possible presentation topic to gather response from the crowd or just introducing yourself to break the ice.

events.name: Clean Architecture for Android
events.description:
This meetup is about how to set up an Android project with clean architecture. Ulrich Raab will share his approach and tips and tricks on how to archive a solid, yet flexible architecture. Afterwards we eat pizza together and have a beer. Pizza and beer will be sponsored by ti&m (many thanks!)
Schedule:

The meetup will be held on 5th floor at Buckhauserstrasse 24, Zürich

- Meetup 18:00
- Talk about Android Architecture 18:30
- Pizza & Beer 19:30

Language: German (Deutsch)

events.name: Practical TensorFlow
events.description:
Googler Martin Wicke will give an introduction in using TensorFlow. Come and join us :)

After the talk we have a drink and enjoy catering together.

Language of the talk: English

events.name: What's Revolutionary about Flutter
events.description:
We have special guest speaker Wm Leler who works for Google on their mobile development framework, Flutter (see https://flutter.io)

Flutter is a new mobile app SDK to help developers and designers build modern, beautiful mobile apps for iOS and Android.

Find out what is new and exciting about Flutter.

events.name: GDG DevFest Switzerland
events.description:
This Years GDG DevFest will be organized again as GDG Switzerland together with GDG Basel, GDG Fribourg, GDG Zürich and GDG Konstanz.

Please see https://devfest.ch for more details and ticket sales, this is just a meta event to let you know.

events.name: Google Actions - First hands on
events.description: This meetup is for everyone who wants to play with the new Google Home and to write there first Google Assistant App.

events.name: TypeScript 2.4, 2.5, 2.6, Firebase Cloud Functions using TypeScript, Socializing
events.description:
It's a pleasure to announce our last Meetup this year which we will organize together with the TypeScript Meetup group.

Lightning talks

1) TypeScript 2.4, 2.5, 2.6, covariance, contravariance and bivariance
2) How to write firebase cloud functions using TypeScript
3) Your talk?

After the lightning talks we will have time to socialize.
events.how_to_find_us: We are on the first floor. Ring the bell at Renuo AG if the doors are closed.

events.name: Public speaking workshop (global diversity CFP day)(Registration required)
events.description:
• What we'll do
Have you always wanted to become a tech conference speaker? Let 2018 be the year that you make that dream a reality!

In this full-day (8 hours) workshop, you will meet friendly mentors who're happy to guide you through the process of becoming a public speaker.

We will cover:

Finding a topic for a talk, finding a topic for a talk, finding a conference that fits you, writing a talk proposal, preparing a talk, talking on stage, tips & tricks for public speaking and we will also do a bit of on-stage training

More information here:
https://www.globaldiversitycfpday.com/events/15

• What to bring
Will be announced to registered attendees.

• Important to know
Please book your 10.- CHF ticket here:
https://ti.to/web-zurich/global-diversity-cfp-day

events.name: Introducing Firebase by WTM Switzerland
events.description:
• What we'll do
This event is hosted by the WTM group (https://www.meetup.com/wtm-switzerland/events/246865421/). But we thought it might be interesting for GDG members too :) So join us and the WTM Switzerland! They will introduce Firebase in a presentation and have a detailed look at Firebase Hosting. In order to do this, we will build our own small website and then deploy it, using Firebase.

• What to bring
Bring your laptop

• Important to know
The workshop is designed for beginners of Firebase

events.name: Do not wast your summer, and learn something about Google Summer of Code
events.description:
During the Meetup we will explain the open source student outreach programs that Google runs - Google Summer of Code (GSoC) for university students and Google Code-in for pre-university students ages 13-17. The GSoC program begins in March so the timing is quite good for talking about that.

Here are some more information.

https://summerofcode.withgoogle.com/

events.name: GDG & WTM Stammtisch
events.description:
• What we'll do
Meeting interesting people, talk about tech, socialise, network or whatever floats your boat ;-)

• Important to know
This is an event hosted by GDG (Google developer group), as well as WTM (Women Techmakers) and aims at bringing people together and foster a diverse environment. See also: https://www.meetup.com/wtm-switzerland/events/247429315/

events.name: Next frontier of mobile development at Google
events.description:
• What we'll do
IMPORTANT: Please note, that you may only apply for this event through this link: https://events.withgoogle.com/next-frontier-mob-dev/. Any registrations through Meetup.com will be ignored.

GDG and Google is excited to welcome you to our Swiss office on Thursday, February 22, 2018.

You will have an opportunity to get to know technologies that drive the next frontier of mobile development: machine learning and cross-device.

Additionally, the event is a platform where Android, iOS and embedded developers can connect, learn from each other, discover new opportunities (such as recently launched Actions on Google web directory) and mobile projects that Google Switzerland is working on.

• What to bring
Nothing else than your curiosity is needed ;)

• Important to know
Please note that registration for this event is only possible through this link: https://events.withgoogle.com/next-frontier-mob-dev/. Also note that because of the limited number of slots, Google will select attendees by their profiles in case there are too many people applying for the event. People will receive a confirmation of their participation 2 weeks before the event.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam
events.description:
• What we'll do
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin?
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam! Together we'll work through three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs, then you will get free access to the next quest so you can finish this series of labs at home to get a Google-hosted badge for your online profile. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes and Scientific Data Processing, which will earn you additional badges.

• Agenda:
18:00: Three Google Cloud Platform Essentials labs (conducted by Jean-Baptiste Clion)
19:30: Break
20:00: Intro to Docker (conducted by Florian Woerner)
21:00: Event ends

• What to bring
Bring a laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed.

• Important to know
Join this meetup to get official Google training, a $70+ value, free of charge.

events.name: GDG & WTM Stammtisch
events.description:

• Important to know

events.name: Web Components Workshop
events.description:
Pretty spontaneous but maybe someone of our community is interested too. An event organised by WTM Zürich :) Thanks a lot!

While the web became more powerful, web applications have become larger and more complex. To provide you with tools and strategies to build web applications in a structured way, Web Components have been created and standardized. In this workshop we will learn:
> - What Web components are and how they help us build web apps
> - How to use the web component standards to create components
> - How to integrate and combine components into an application

What to bring:
- Basic understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
- Your laptop with a browser (preferred: Chrome or Firefox)

This workshop will be run by our lovely Martin Splitt <3

events.name: IWD 18 Conference
events.description:
Building a New Horizon
IWD 18 Conference

This is an event organized by WTM Switzerland: https://www.meetup.com/wtm-switzerland/events/248198370/

!!External registration required (link below)!!

This WTM conference is held in celebration of the International Women's Day 2018. It aims at bringing people together to learn and to be inspired. We will have technical and non-technical talks from professional, as well as first-time speakers, and we will have parallel workshops in the afternoon.

Attendance is free and participants will be provided with lunch and beverages throughout the day.

Find out more information about the schedule and register your ticket here:
https://iwd18.womentechmakers.ch

• What to bring
For the conference you need to bring yourself! We will inform workshop participants independently.

• Important to know
You need to register for a free ticket to this event. Meetup RSVP is not enough, availability is limited.

We are looking forward to a great event!

events.name: TensorFlow DevSummit Replay
events.description:
• What we'll do

Join with us 12th April 2018 in Google Zürich, Shilpost to view the TensorFlow summit replay. Introduction to TensorFlow will also be provided.

!! UPDATE - GET READY !!
Before the live streaming, we will start with a very simple step-by-step tutorial on TensorFlow. This would allow you to understand what TensorFlow is about.

In order to maximise time on the CodeLab, we would kindly ask you to pre-install TensorFlow on your machine. Please find installation guidelines: https://www.tensorflow.org/install.

Please also make sure you have successfully run the "Validate your installation" section. This installation should take 5 to 10 minutes and be pretty straight forward. If you might have any trouble during the installation process, please let us know.

TensorFlow Dev Summit brings together a diverse mix of machine learning users from around the world for a full day of highly technical talks, demos, and conversation with the TensorFlow team and community.

• What to bring
Your laptop with up-to-date Google chrome browser
No expertise in Machine Learning is required to attend the event

• Agenda
17:00 - 17:15: Welcome
17:15 - 18:00: CodeLab on TensorFlow
18:00 - 18:30: Break
18:30 - 19:00: Streaming Keynote
19:00 - 20:00: Streaming Sessions (Food Time!)
20:00 - 20:30: Networking

events.name: Flutter - the new kind from the block
events.description:
Details
First of all, we are happy to announce that this is our first Meetup together with the App Builders Zürich community :) So join us together with the guys from App Builders on our Meeup to explore Flutter. Flutter is one of the top trending repositories on GitHub nowadays. It is Google’s mobile UI Framework to create native iOS / Android Apps and aims to revolutionise mobile app development.

************************************************

The Presentation
Patrice Müller (Android) and Renato Stauffer (iOS) will be talking about how Flutter works, their experience using the framework and explain how to get started. After the talk we will enjoy snacks & drinks and socialise / network.

**********************************************

About the Speakers
Renato touched iOS the first time in 2012 and never looked back since then. After graduating at Berner Fachhochschule in Business Information Systems he moved to Zürich to develop iOS applications full time. He worked on many banking / P2P payment apps including Paymit (what eventually became Twint) and never got warm with cross platform development until he discovered Flutter at Google IO 2017.

Patrice started Android development back in 2010 when he was a Student at Hochschule für Technik Rapperswil . Since then he worked on many different Android / cross platform projects including SBB Mobile, Paymit and NEMO (Post) for different agencies. He started his journey in cross platform development with Mobile GWT and tried other approaches including Ionic or Xamarin. After a lot of frustration with many of the mentioned cross platform approaches he ended up linking one: Flutter

************************************************

Sponsors
The event will be held at the Swisscom Tower. So thank you Swisscome for hosting the event :) and GDG Zürich for providing the refreshments.

************************************************

Event Details
Entrance is free and language will be in English.

************************************************

Present your App experiences
*If you are interested in presenting about App development, ML, etc. please contact us and we will find a date for you.

events.name: Hacker's guide to landing a job you'll love

venue.name: Impact Hub Colab - Loft Corner, 4th floor

events.description:
Career changes are among the handful of the most impactful decisions each of us is going to make in our lives. And yet so little non-superficial, common sense knowledge about these processes is available out there.

Combining his engineering perspective and experience of being involved in thousands of recruitment processes, Piotr will share how he thinks you should approach interviewing - to figure out whether a particular company is the right fit for you or not... and how to get the job if it is.

Speaker - Piotr Nedzynski
Piotr is a tech entrepreneur with software engineering background. He co-founded the first startup community in Krakow and grew it to be the biggest startup community in Poland at the time. More recently, first as a COO and then Head of Talent, he helped grow Base - the biggest startup in Poland - from 10 hackers working in an apartment to a highly effective R&D organisation of about 120

events.name: Android Advanced Topics and Performance
events.description:
We are happy to announce a meetup for Android Natives. Together with Women Techmakers Zuerich and Swisscom Technologies, we have the chance to give you the opportunity to learn up to date best practices on android development.

* What to expect
Besides Flutter and Kotlin, things are still changing in the android world. With this meetup we would like to give you the possibility to learn about best practices from a performance perspective.

• What we'll do
This event will be split in two parts. As a warm up, there will be a session shown from the Google IO 2018 about Advanced Topics on Android - "Protips: a fresh look at advanced topics for Android experts". After this warm up we are very happy to welcome our speaker of the evening Doug Sillars on his talk “Performance of Mobile Apps” - A talk that goes over best practices, and shows examples of how improvements made mobile apps run better. After this session, feel free to ask questions to Doug and there will also be time for social networking.

* What to bring
Please bring your curiosity and excitement on the topic. If you have questions regarding the topic performance, please also take those with you

* What's the timetable for this event
18:15 opening door to the event
18:30 Start Session about ProTips
19:30 Break
19:45 Start Session about Performance of Mobile Apps
20:30 Questions/Social Networking

events.name: Make Zürich Hackathon
events.description:
Get ready for the next edition of Make Zurich hackathon!
This year, we make a community partnership with MakeZürich.

WHAT IS IT?
We are bringing together the local hacker/maker community and the city administration to explore new ways of solving the problems of our city with the help of open networks and civic tech.

Please note that this is only a meta event page in our community, registration happens on https://makezurich.ch but you can register for this event here to get the news and see who else from the GDG community will be there as well.

Registration is open, please see makezurich.ch for details about the challenges and the registration button.

• What we'll do
Meeting interesting people, talk about tech, socialise, network or whatever floats your boat ;-)

This is an event hosted by GDG (Google developer group), as well as WTM (Women Techmakers) and aims at bringing people together and foster a diverse environment. See also: https://www.meetup.com/wtm-switzerland/

events.name: Progressive Web Apps - How to succeed in the web of tomorrow
events.description:
While the web became more powerful, it's crucial for businesses to get the most out of it. Progressive Web Apps are a big part of it and businesses worldwide have already implemented it and reached great results. In this workshop we will learn following:

>- Why PWA’s are so useful (incl. some really impressive examples)
>- How to migrate an existing web project to a PWA
>- How to make use of PWA’s best features, like sending Push notifications, Offline Content and providing Install prompts

What to bring:
- Basic understanding of HTML, CSS and JavaScript
- Your laptop with a browser (optional: Git and Code Editor installed)
- Good Mood 😊

We're thankful to ERNI for providing us their office space to host this event there.
events.how_to_find_us: Mit dem Lift in den 4. Stock, bei ERNI

events.name: [Talks & Drinks] Rethinking User Experience Design
events.description:
A good user experience is crucial to the success of a product. But how do we approach user-centric design these days? How can we structure information and organize our environments to create the best user experience?

We gladly welcome Laura Summers (https://twitter.com/summerscope) who came all the way to Australia to present alternative and component driven design processes.

Shortly we will announce more amazing speakers. As usual, we will provide snacks and drinks and a great atmosphere :)

A big thank you to JobCloud for providing us with a wonderful venue, snacks and drinks.
www.jobcloud.ch

Schedule
18:00 - 18:15 Arrival, Drinks and Conversations
18:15 - 19:00 Burn the concept mocks by Laura Summers
19:00 - 19:30 How to become a UX designer in 30 minutes by Gion Kunz
19:45 - 20:15 Machine Learning for Designers by Memi Beltrame
20:15 Drinks, Snacks and Conversations

Details

Burn the concept mocks
_____________________________________________________________________

Bring your blow torches people, because it’s time to burn some stuff down! We’ll discuss the high fidelity design phase and consider alternatives. We should be refining product UI in an iterative and component-driven way that matches the development flow - based on my earlier blog post of the same name (have a read if you have time! https://blog.prototypr.io/burn-the-concept-mocks-4afe78e5f7ab). Are you ready? Let’s do it! Let’s give ourselves permission to redesign the way we design.

Laura is a multi-disciplinary designer working across user experience research, design and front-end development for startups. Asking questions, unpacking assumptions and trying to get to the bottom of things are some of her favourite activities - supported by methodologies all the cool kids are using, such as Lean, Agile and Design Thinking. She's a passionate advocate for improving diversity in technology and ensuring our workplaces are welcoming and inclusive. Also: cats rule, dogs drool.

How to become a UX designer in (50) 30 minutes
_____________________________________________________________________

Many people believe that UX designers are a rare species, descended from unicorns, who create their designs in magical clearings in the forest during full moon. Well, this is obviously not the case. Proper UX Design follows a clear and rational process. This talk is for UX unicorn believers, developers or designers who work with developers and it aims to demystify a user centered UX process by showing a practical and rational UX process from start to finish.

Machine Learning for Designers
_____________________________________________________________________

Artificial Intelligence sits at the core of the biggest transformation of our industry: the convergence of Industrial Design, Interaction Design and Service Design forming a new mega-discipline. With it comes the need for designers to evolve into new fields, one of which is Machine Learning.
This talk is about what Machine Learning is, how it is driving the change in our industry, and what of it is important for designers.

Memi is an experience designer with more backgrounds than a Wes Anderson movie. He's a college dropout (English Literature & Linguistics) and a trained film director. He's been writing code since he was 13, with absolutely no ambition other than to see what happens. This ambition got him to the field of UX where he enjoys finding out what people need, building it and having a good cry after testing.
He is curious and if you give him a stick and a bear, he'll know what to do. He's not good at sports, so you might reconsider.

More talks will be announced soon.

events.name: DevFest Switzerland 2018
events.description:
IMPORTANT: For this event, you need to have a ticket! Tickets are only available here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/devfest-2018-tickets-45157555464#tickets

Are you a tech enthusiast, a student or an IT professional and want to take a deep dive into cutting edge technologies like Machine Learning, AR, Mobile Development and more? Or do you want to explore these technologies and don’t know where to start? Perhaps you are even facing a very specific challenge that you want to solve and would like to talk to an expert in one of these fields?

Don’t panic!

This year, during week 42, the DevFest Switzerland 2018 comes to the rescue. On 20. / 21. October 2018, the third DevFest Switzerland will take place in Rapperswil and you are welcome to join this journey with the GDG Zürich, Women Techmakers Switzerland, GDG Fribourg and GDG Bern.

Our world class speakers will provide you with a hitchhiker's guide to the galaxies of Machine Learning, AR, Mobile Development and more! In our workshops, you will be able to get hands on experience with likeminded people. And if you should feel tired at some point, there is always the Retro-Gaming Corner, which will refresh your mind to find your answers to the ultimate question of life, the universe and everything ;)

Don’t hesitate and get your ticket now: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/devfest-2018-tickets-45157555464#tickets

The ticket will include the following
- 13 sessions over 2 days
- Workshops to join
- Food and coffee
- Swags

More information about the event can be found here: https://devfest.ch/

We are happy to have you on board! Cu there!

events.name: Hacktoberfest Zurich 2018

venue.name: Impact Hub Colab - Loft Corner, 4th floor

events.description:
In the spirit of open source and Hacktoberfest we come together to work on open source software, to give back to the community. This is all about encouraging meaningful contributions to the open source ecosystem, for beginners and veterans alike. We will organize a place to work with internet access, and provide guidance to help you contribute to open source.

# Agenda

The event starts between 17:30-18:30, the rest of the agenda will be announced soon.

# Location

Impact Hub Colab, Loft Corner, 4th floor
Sihlquai 131
8005 Zürich

# Rules

To get a shirt, you must make five pull requests (PRs) between October 1–31 in any timezone. PRs can be to any public repo on GitHub, not just the ones highlighted. The PR must contain commits you made yourself. PRs reported by maintainers as spam or that are automated will be marked as invalid and won't count towards the shirt. This year, the first 50,000 of you can earn a T-shirt (compared with 30,000 in 2017).

# Values

Hacktoberfest guiding values:

* Everyone is welcome
* Quantity is fun, quality is key
* Short term actions, long term impact

# What to Bring

You need to bring your own laptop.

# Other

You can start hacking before the event, and continue hacking after the event. And if you cannot make the event, we still encourage you to participate in the global Hacktoberfest: https://hacktoberfest.digitalocean.com/

Please read our Events Code of Conduct (http://do.co/hacktoberconduct) before attending. Happy hacking!

events.name: Christmas Bash - Let's Celebrate!
events.description:
Exact details will be provided later.

This is an event together with Women Techmakers Switzerland :) The idea is to have a cosy get together with hot wine, Christmas cookies and nice people :)

Schedule:

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android with the same codebase in record time. It is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

This event is going to be a viewing party of the event that takes place in London on the 4th of December. There will be announced a variety of news and updates about Flutter.

More info you can find here: https://developers.google.com/events/flutter-live/

Attention:
In order to attend this meetup, we require that you enter your details in the rsvp. (security badges)

events.name: Selenium - Automation at its finest
events.description:
Seleniums WebDriver protocol has officially reached the recommended state from W3C and is a key technology for general automation and especially automated regression tests in the day of DevOps. There are many Tools and Frameworks in the open source as well as the closed source ecosystems that make use of it underneath and you can do as well. This event is in collaboration with the Zürich Selenium meetup group (https://www.meetup.com/Zurich-Selenium-Meetup) and intended as a kick-off event to start a new series of events around Selenium including topics like how different tools & Frameworks are in use right now, how to build, maintain and operate infrastructure to support your teams and many more.

We will have 2 speakers telling you about how they use Selenium. There will be a Networking part afterwards where you can connect while having a drink.
Many thanks to AXA for sponsoring the location and the Apéro.

Michel Hostettler from AXA-Winterthur will wrap-up the past 6 years of Selenium-Testing @ AXA with Lessons Learned from why Selenium-Testing is not just Selenium over which technology to choose, Toolkits, where you need to focus on up to revealing what their biggest learnings are.

Adrian Herzog from Zühlke Engineering will give you a look into Scenarioo - Test-Driven Documentation & Visual Regression Testing.
Automated UI tests are one way to document the features of an application. Everybody involved in the project should be able to easily browse them, with screenshots, test results and all kinds of other useful information. By visually comparing the results of two test runs, you can even find potential bugs that the test suite did not find. The open source tool Scenarioo (http://www.scenarioo.org) can make all this happen and much more!

events.name: International Womens Day: Cloud Study Jam @Google
events.description:
IMPORTANT: REGISTER HERE TO ATTEND: https://events.withgoogle.com/csj-for-wit/

8th of March is International Women's day 🎉 this needs proper celebration!

This year, we organize a Cloud Study Jam event together with Google. You will get free access to online training, as well as help from Googlers to learn about the cloud. Even more, you will get free access to these online trainings for 30 more days, so that you can complete your trainings at your convenience.

There is no previous knowledge required. We have trainings for all levels. So everyone is very welcome to join!

Snacks and drinks will be provided.

Please register here for the Zurich event: https://events.withgoogle.com/csj-for-wit/. Keep in mind that we can only accept attendees with registration.

We are looking forward to welcoming you to this International Women's Day Celebration ✨

events.name: Building smarter solutions with Machine Learning, from magic to reality
events.description:
Nowadays everybody talks about machine learning. Even it looks like magic, it doesnt have to be like this. Join us on the meetup in which Laurent from Google shows us how todo it without magic. This meetup is targeted to developers and not magicians or experts, so reserve a seat and just come by. If you cannot join, please cancel your registration and enable somebody else to join.
This Meetup is hosted by Google Developers Group and Women Techmakers.

Outline:
“Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.” — Arthur C Clarke
Well, machine learning can look like magic, but we don't need to be data scientists or ML researchers to develop with ML. So, what about making our solutions smarter without any knowledge in AI? In this session, we’ll see how to transform or extract information from text, image, audio & video with the latest ML APIs, how to train an AutoML custom model, and we’ll be active players of a live demo. Don't put your smartphone on airplane mode!

Agenda:
18:45 - 19:00 welcome
19:00 - Start Talk from Laurent
After that Questions, Apero and networking

Attention:
In order to attend this meetup, we require that you enter your first name and last name to print security badges.

Light snacks and drinks will be provided.

Bio:
Laurent is a developer passionate about software, hardware, science and anything shaping the future. He works for Google where he ecstatically explores cloud technologies. In a previous life, he pioneered the ebook industry, co-created the first European ebook reader, and co-founded Bookeen. He now enjoys sharing his passion in international conferences. You can find him on twitter at @PicardParis.

events.name: Flutter #1: Create beautiful apps in record time
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android with the same codebase in record time. It is used by developers and organizations around the world and it is free and open source.

In this event, you will get to know about Flutter. No previous knowledge is required. It is the first event of two where you get a full understanding of Flutter.
The second event: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Zurich/events/260276024/
The second event by WTM: https://www.meetup.com/wtm-switzerland/events/260275037/

Agenda:
18.00 - 18.10 - Welcome
18.15 - 18.35 - Introduction to Flutter, Katarina Sheremet, Google Developer Expert in Flutter. She will tell us about the features of Flutter, explains the difference between Stateful and Stateless widgets, and show how to use Flutter tools to boost your development cycle.
18.35 - 19.15 - Creating cool UIs with Flutter, Sergi Martínez, Google Developer Expert in Flutter. An introduction to the common elements to be used when creating UIs in Flutter. Starting from the ground and step-by-step, we will review how to create a UI with the basic widgets, including lists, cards, images, etc. We will see different strategies on how to layout elements, including Rows, Columns, Stacks, and other Widgets from the Flutter framework.
19.15 - 20.30 - Networking

Attention:
In order to attend this meetup, we require that you enter your first name and last name to print security badges.

Light snacks and drinks will be provided.

events.name: Flutter #2: Create beautiful apps in record time
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android with the same codebase in record time. It is used by developers and organizations around the world and it is free and open source.

In this event, you will get to know about Flutter. It is the second event of two where you get a full understanding of Flutter.
First event: https://www.meetup.com/GDG-Zurich/events/260276281/
OR first event: https://www.meetup.com/wtm-switzerland/events/260274293/

Agenda:
18.00 - 18.10 - Welcome

18.15 - 18.55 - Booting Fuchsia, burying Android, Rubén Serrano. How many Android devices can update to the newest OS version after 2 years? In case you are a mobile developer, how it feels supporting different OS versions that can behave completely different? How many times have you wished to use any language as a first-class citizen for mobile development? In this talk we will show how Fuchsia addresses the former problems with its modular design and its new kernel created from scratch (no Linux here); its use of AI; and its UI SDK, based on Flutter, which also lets you reuse the app for Android and iOS (and other desktop OS and the web in the near future). But it doesn't stop here, and Fuchsia will be the OS for any kind of device, from IoT devices to the Cloud.

19.00 - 19.45 - New kid in the BLoC, Filipe A. Barroso. The goal of this talk is that the end of 40 minutes you will have a better understanding of state management in Flutter, through BLoC, InheritedWidget & Scoped model, Redux, and less known MobX. So that in your next Flutter project you will have better confidence in why you pick one and not the other.

19.45 - 20.30 - The sharp Corners of BLoC, Katarina Sheremet.

20.30 - 21.00 - Networking

Attention:
In order to attend this meetup, we require that you enter your real first name and last name to print security badges.

Light snacks and drinks will be provided.

group_profile.intro: One of the GDG Zuerich leads ;-)
Just do some stuff in mobile development
